Variable description: Indicates whether a person had dementia at the time of entry into the study; converted to dementia or did not show dementia during the study period
Delay between MR imaging and other assessments
Age at time of image acquisition (years)
Socioeconomic status as assessed by the Hollingshead Index of Social Position and classified into categories from 1 (highest status) to 5 (lowest status) (Hollingshead 1957)
Mini-Mental State Examination score (range is from 0 = worst to 30 = best) (Folstein Folstein & McHugh 1975)
Clinical Dementia Rating (0 = no dementia; 0.5 = very mild AD; 1 = mild AD; 2 = moderate AD) (Morris 1993)
Estimated total intracranial volume (cm3) (Buckner et al. 2004)

Normalized whole-brain volume expressed as a percent of all voxels in the atlas-masked image that are labeled as gray or white matter by the automated tissue segmentation process (Fotenos et al. 2005)
Atlas scaling factor (unitless). Computed scaling factor that transforms native-space brain and skull to the atlas target (i.e. the determinant of the transform matrix) (Buckner et al. 2004)
